tuv.seg: Family and shared homes
Teach an teaghlaigh agus tithe comhroinnte
The law in Ireland distinguishes between a family home and a shared home
Déanann an dlí in Éirinn idirdhealú idir teach an teaghlaigh agus teach comhroinnte
A family home primarily means, a dwelling in which a married couple ordinarily resides
Is é an chiall atá le teach an teaghlaigh, áit chónaithe ina gcónaíonn lánúin phósta, de ghnáth

Whilst some family homes are held in the sole name of one spouse, many family homes are held in the names of both spouses as a joint tenancy as this is often a condition of the mortgage used to buy the house

Cé gurb in ainm duine de na céilí a bhíonn ainmneach tithe teaghlaigh de ghnáth, bíonn ainm na beirte céilí ar theach an teaghlaigh mar chomhthionóntacht mar gheall gur minic a bhíonn seo mar choinníoll den mhorgáiste a úsáideadh chun an teach a cheannach
The Government encourages spouses to put the family home into their joint names and there is no stamp duty or registry fees payable on the transfer of a family home into a joint tenancy
Spreagann an rialtas dhá ainm na gcéilí a chur ar theach an teaghlaigh agus níl aon dleacht stampála nó táille chláraithe le híoc ar aistriú an dá ainm ar theach an teaghlaigh chuig comhthionóntacht
According to the Civil Partnership and Certain Rights and Obligations of Cohabitants Act 2010 a shared home is a dwelling where civil partners ordinarily reside
De réir an Achta um Páirtnéireacht Shibhialta agus Cearta agus Oibleagáidí Áirithe de chuid Comhchónaitheoirí, 2010 is áit chónaithe teach comhroinnte ina gcónaíonn páirtnéirí sibhialta de ghnáth
Where the shared home is held in the name of one of the civil partners, there is no stamp duty or registry fees payable on the transfer of the shared home into both their names as a joint tenancy

Nuair a bhíonn an teach comhroinnte in ainm duine de na páirtnéirí sibhialta, níl aon dleacht stampála nó táille chláraithe le híoc ar aistriú an tí chomhroinnte chuig ainmneacha na beirte mar chomhthionóntacht
Protection is provided for the family home of a married couple under the Family Home Protection Act 1976 as amended by the Family Law Act 1995
Foráiltear cosaint do theach teaghlaigh lánúine pósta faoin Acht um Chaomhnú Áras an Teaghlaigh, 1976 arna leasú ag an Acht um an Dlí Teaghlaigh,1995
Similar protection is provided for the shared home of civil partners by the civil partnership legislation
Foráiltear a chomhionann de chosaint do theach comhroinnte páirtnéirí sibhialta ag an reachtaíocht um páirtnéireacht shibhialta
This legislation prevents one spouse/civil partner from selling, mortgaging, leasing or transferring the family/shared home without the consent of the other spouse/civil partner

Cuireann an reachtaíocht seo cosc ar chéile/pháirtnéir sibhialta amháin ó theach an teaghlaigh/theach comhroinnte a dhíol, a mhorgáistiú, a ligean ar léas nó a aistriú gan toiliú na céile/an pháirtnéara shibhialta eile
The courts can dispense with the other spouse's/civil partner’s consent where it considers that the withholding of consent is unreasonable
Féadfaidh na cúirteanna ligean thar ceal thoiliú na céile/an pháirtnéara shibhialta eile nuair a mheasann siad gur mí-réasúnta siarchoinneáil an toilithe

A spouse/civil partner is also able to apply to the courts for orders restraining the other spouse/civil partner from doing anything that might reduce his or her interest in the shared home or make it unsuitable to live in

Féadfaidh céile/páirtnéir sibhialta iarratas a dhéanamh ar na cúirteanna ar orduithe a leagann srian ar an gcéile/bpáirtnéir sibhialta eile ó aon rud a dhéanamh a d’fhéadfadh a leas sa teach comhroinnte a laghdú nó an teach mí-oiriúnach a dhéanamh den teach sin chun cónaí ann
A spouse/civil partner may inform the Property Registration Authority that he or she is the spouse/civil partner of a property owner
Féadfaidh céile/páirtnéir sibhialta an tÚdarás Clárúcháin Maoine a chur ar an eolas gur céile/páirtnéir sibhialta iad le húinéir réadmhaoine
A notice to that effect will then be registered
Clárófar fógra chuige sin ina dhiaidh sin
There is no charge for such a registration
Ní ghearrtar aon mhuirear ar chlárúchán den sórt sin
There is no requirement to enter such a registration and its absence does not affect the rights of a spouse/civil partner
Níl aon cheanglas ann chun iontráil ina leithéid de chlárú agus mura ndéantar amhlaidh, ní dhéantar difear do chearta céile/páirtnéara shibhialta
The protection provided by the legislation is particularly important when the home is held in the name of only one spouse/civil partner
Baineann tábhacht ar leith leis an gcosaint a chuireann an reachtaíocht ar fáil, nuair a bhíonn an teach á choimeád faoi ainm duine amháin de na céilí/páirntéirí sibhialta
One of the biggest problems facing separating couples/partners is what should happen to their family/shared home
Ceann de na fadhbanna is mó a bhíonn ar lánúineacha/páirtnéirí a bhíonn ag scaradh óna chéile ná céard atá le tarlú do theach a dteaghlaigh/dá dteach comhroinnte
If agreement cannot be reached as to who will occupy and own the family/shared home, the court can make an order in relation to it
Murar féidir comhaontú a bhaint amach maidir le cé a chónóidh i dteach an teaghlaigh/sa teach comhroinnte agus cé leis iad, féadfaidh an chúirt ordú a dhéanamh ina thaobh
An order in relation to the family/shared home is usually applied for when applying for a decree of judicial separation, divorce or dissolution and is referred to as a property adjustment order

Is gnách go ndéantar iarratas ar ordú i dtaca le teach an teaghlaigh/teach comhroinnte nuair a dhéantar iarratas ar fhoraithne idirscartha bhreithiúnaigh, cholscartha nó dhíscaoilte agus tugtar ordú coigeartaithe réadmhaoine air
In making a property adjustment order, a court will consider all of the family circumstances and will take into account the welfare of a dependent spouse/civil partner and any dependent children

Agus ordú coigeartaithe réadmhaoine á dhéanamh, déanfaidh cúirt breithniú ar gach ceann de chúinsí an teaghlaigh agus cuirfidh siad i gcuntas leas cleithiúnaí céile/páirtnéara shibhialta agus aon leanbh cleithiúnach
The court order will state the following:
Luafaidh an t-ordú cúirte an méid a leanas:
• Who has the right to live in the family/shared home and for how long
• Cé aige/aici a bhfuil an ceart chun cónaí i dteach an teaghlaigh/sa teach comhroinnte agus cé chomh fada is féidir leo amhlaidh a dhéanamh
• Who has ownership rights in the family/shared home and what share does each spouse/civil partner own
• Cé aige/aici a bhfuil na cearta úinéireachta i dteach an teaghlaigh/sa teach comhroinnte agus cén sciar ar leis gach céile/páirtnéir sibhialta
Who has the right to live in the home and for how long?
Cé aige/aici atá an ceart chun cónaí sa teach agus cé chomh fada is féidir leo cónaí ann?
In the case of a married couple where there are children, the spouse with whom the children live will often be given the right to live in the family home until the youngest child reaches 18 or 23

I gcás lánúin phósta ag a bhfuil clann, is gnách go dtabharfar an ceart don chéile lena gcónaíonn na leanaí chun cónaí i dteach an teaghlaigh go dtí go mbaineann an leanbh is óige 18 nó 23 bliain amach
This can provide a sense of continuity for children who are experiencing the separation of their parents
Féadfaidh seo braistint leanúnachais a chur ar fáil do leanaí atá thíos le scaradh a dtuismitheoirí
The Children and Family Relationships Act 2015 has amended the civil partnership legislation to provide similar protection for dependent children of civil partners
Leasaigh Acht na Leanaí agus Teaghlaigh Caidrimh 2015 an reachtaíocht páirtnéireachta sibhialta chun cosaint den chineál céanna do leanaí cleithiúnacha páirtnéirí sibhialta a chur ar fáil
The court can make an exclusion order in relation to the spouse/civil partner who is leaving the family/shared home
Féadfaidh an chúirt ordú eisiaimh a dhéanamh maidir leis an gcéile/bpáirtnéir sibhialta atá ag fágáil theach an teaghlaigh/an tí chomhroinnte

An exclusion order reflects the recognition of the courts that it is not practical for separated couples/partners to occupy the same house or for the spouses/civil partners who leave to retain a key and have free access to the house

Léiríonn ordú eisiaimh go n-aithníonn na cúirteanna nach indeánta do lánúineacha/pháirtnéirí idirscartha cónaí sa teach céanna nó do chéilí/pháirtnéirí sibhialta a fhágann chun eochair a choimeád agus rochtain gan chosc a bheith acu ar an teach
It does not imply any unacceptable conduct on the part of the spouses/civil partners who are excluded from the house
Ní chiallaíonn sé go bhfuil aon iompar neamh-inghlactha ar bun ag na céilí/páirtnéirí sibhialta atá eisiata ón teach
Who has ownership rights in the home and what share does each spouse/civil partner own?
Cé aige/aici a bhfuil na cearta úinéireachta sa teach agus cén sciar ar leis gach céile/páirtnéir sibhialta?
A court can order that the house is sold and the proceeds divided equally or in whatever shares it considers just
Is féidir leis an gcúirt a ordú go ndíolfar an teach agus go roinnfear an fáltas go cothrom eatarthu nó go dtugtar an sciar dóibh a mheastar is cóir
It can order that the sale be deferred for a specified period of time
Féadfaidh siad a ordú go gcuirtear an díol ar athló ar feadh tréimhse shonrach ama
It can order the transfer of the house into joint names or into the sole name of one spouse/civil partner
Féadfaidh siad a ordú go n-aistreofar an teach i gcomhainmneacha nó in ainm duine amháin de na céilí/páirtnéirí sibhialta
If the house is held under a tenancy from a local authority, it can order the transfer of the tenancy
Má tá seilbh ar an teach faoi thionóntacht ó údarás áitiúil, féadfaidh siad aistriú na tionóntachta a ordú
Whether you are considering separating or applying for a decree of divorce/dissolution it is advisable to get legal advice
Cibé acu má tá tú ag smaoineamh faoi idirscaradh a fháil nó iarratas a dhéanamh ar fhoraithne cholscartha/dhíscaoilte, moltar duit comhairle dlí a fháil
If you choose to hire a private solicitor, you should be aware that there is no fixed rate of charges for legal fees in Ireland
Ma roghnaíonn tú chun aturnae príobháideach a fháil, ba cheart duit a bheith feasach nach ann d’aon ráta seasta muirear le haghaidh táillí dlí in Éirinn
You are advised to obtain some quotes before deciding on a legal firm
Moltar duit roinnt meastacháin luacha a fháil sula ndéanann tú cinneadh ar ghnóthas dlíthiúil
Contact information for solicitors firms throughout Ireland is available on the Law Society website
Tá fáil ar fháisnéis teagmhála ar ghnóthais aturnaetha ar fud na hÉireann ar láithreán gréasáin Dhlí-Chumann na hÉireann
To enquire whether you are eligible for legal aid or advice from the Legal Aid Board, contact your nearest law centre
Chun fiosrúchán a dhéanamh faoi cibé acu an bhfuil tú i dteideal cúnamh nó comhairle dlí a fháil ón mBord um Chúnamh Dlíthiúil, déan teagmháil le d’ionad dlí áitiúil
The law centre staff will assess your means and advise on financial eligibility
Déanfaidh foireann an ionaid dlí measúnú ar do mhaoin agus comhairle a chur ort faoi theidlíocht airgeadais
Legal aid is not free and everyone must pay a contribution towards costs
Níl cúnamh dlíthiúil saor in aisce agus tá ar gach duine ranníocaíocht a íoc i dtreo na gcostas
FLAC (Free Legal Advice Centres) is an independent, voluntary organisation that operates a network of legal advice clinics throughout the country
Is eagraíocht neamhspleách, dheonach FLAC (Ionaid Chomhairle Dlí Saor in Aisce) a oibríonn líonra de chlinicí um chomhairle dhlíthiúil ar fud na tíre
These clinics are confidential, free of charge and open to all
Tá na clinicí seo faoi rún agus saor in aisce do chách
Contact your nearest Citizens Information Centre for information on FLAC services in your area
Déan teagmháil le d’Ionad um Fhaisnéis do Shaoránaigh áitiúil chun teacht ar fhaisnéis ar sheirbhísí FLAC i do cheantar
FLAC also runs an information and referral line during office hours for basic legal information
Ina theannta sin, tá líne faisnéise agus atreoraithe á reáchtáil ag an FLAC le linn uaireanta oifige le haghaidh faisnéis bhunúsach dhlíthiúil
